author: {'steamid': '76561198009489582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1615255723}
review: It's been a great tool to learn Hiragana.  Much more fun than using a book.  An RPG to learn is a clever twist!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969101080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1615042834}
review:
Uno degli ostacoli principali nell'approcciarsi alla lingua giapponese sono i suoi tre tipi di scrittura, con un numero di simboli molto elevato e assai lontano dal nostro uso dell'alfabeto. Un grande lavoro mnemonico che va necessariamente fatto a monte, prima della comprensione del testo e relativa grammatica.

Questo titolo fa parte di un trittico di jrpg didattici, ognuno focalizzato sul relativo alfabeto, in questo caso l'Hiragana. Non è quindi un corso di giapponese, ma una sorta di videogioco in cui la memorizzazione dell'Hiragana è propedeutica all'avanzamento e in cui la storia stessa, con pretesti un po' assurdi ma simpatici a livello narrativo, ruota attorno all'argomento.

Chiaramente non va misurato con il metro del videogioco, nessuno giocherebbe Learn Japanese to Survive per puro diletto, benché non sia terribile in assoluto. Come strumento di studio è invece interessante. Il titolo invoglia, cosa che suggerisco caldamente anche io, ad avere un quaderno in cui scrivere i vari insegnamenti che gradualmente il gioco propone. Ed allenarsi sulla grafia e sulla memorizzazione, a meno di non avere una memoria portentosa dubito che le 10-15 ore di gioco vi basteranno per ricordare decine di simboli e relative sillabe.

Il titolo ha un prezzo abbordabile, che merita ampiamente, e partecipa spesso ai saldi. L'importante è capire quale sia la sua funzione, senza irrealistiche illusioni di apprendimenti senza fatica o chissà quali profondità ludiche: andrebbe usato solo da chi ha un interesse concreto nella materia e magari parallelamente a metodi "convenzionali". A scanso di equivoci, è tutto in inglese (come da scheda Steam) quindi è indispensabile capirlo bene per poter seguire gli insegnamenti proposti.

author: {'steamid': '76561199117494032', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1614433202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060918996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1614087132}
review: Unfortunately, i can't really recommend this. A set of flashcards will allow you to learn more far quicker than this game. Too slow paced. Perhaps gladiator style battles would work far better than a long drawn out RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053854890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1614039880}
review: i am learning slowly but the game/learning could be a bit better by adding the party members saying the Pronunciations as they attack so i don't have to re do the lessons 100x to keep hearing the pronunciations. even if you just make the teacher say it when she attacks it would be something since there all ready a female sound file in the game during the lessons. then if there is one i am unsure  of i can just have her attack it. i getting good at them memorization, but i am lacking at the pronunciations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078661077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1696913556}
review: Definitely wished this game was around when I was learning Hiragana. This beats any textbook while capturing the basic fundamentals of Japanese Alphabet. Great way to learn while being completely engaged in story-line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094426470', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1619111095}
review: Definitely recommend this game for people who are interested in learning Japanese. It's great for beginners. The game teaches you how to pronounce and write each hiragana character, and I've found it very helpful for memorizing them. It also teaches you some basic vocab and phrases. I haven't finished it yet, but from what I've heard, the game is pretty short. However, I highly recommend taking your time and taking notes. It'll be hard to actually learn if you just rush through the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199093884770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1613680395}
review: If you're looking to start learning how to write hiragana, I would recommend this. As someone who studied Japanese before, this was a great refresher for not having looked at anything in the last 12 years. The game itself gets a bit repetitive and the characters appear as often as a Zubat does in Pokemon, but it's the repetition that helps you learn. You can always revisit lessons and even go back when you beat the game. I would recommend writing everything that is learned down so you have something to reference. All-in-all, it's a simple game that can be beat in a day or two maybe three, but I wouldn't recommend rushing or you won't learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1684763739}
review:
This is an educational game intended to teach the Japanese Hiragana Alphabet.  Gameplay consists of a VN/JRPG where the monsters are characters that must be translated. 

While there's nobility in education, the implementation here is too poor to recommend.  Pixel "art" has been used in some places, inexplicably jarring with the tolerable hand drawn manga style art in other places.  Also, there's no fullscreen mode, despite this being published in 2018.  Did they not pick that up in testing?  

The quality here is simply too low to make this recommendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202396131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1619570981}
review:
(Note: Quite a few of these hours were spent in idle and not actually playing the game, BUT a lot of hours HAVE been put in; and are STILL BEING put in.}

I absolutely recommend this game for those who are learning Japanese. I'd suggest you learn a bit about Hiragana first, as once you're thrown into battle, it gets REAL. But every "lesson" teaches you step-by-step each character, from pronunciation to how to correctly write each line. And the "battle" system really drills each character into you over and over as you get deeper and deeper into the game, especially as points between lessons get longer and longer.
It also does a good job in teaching you some keywords in Japanese, but most of these words are written in Romanji (English, but written as it's meant to be pronounced in Japanese; which you can listen to until you are able to parrot it back, if needed, when you first learn each word, like each character,)
Anyway. This game is basically a simple RPG, except you learn Japanese/fight in Japanese; (If you try the game, you'll learn what I mean.) It's a unique educational game that is managing to do what a lot of other games couldn't help me do, personally. So again, I really recommend this game if you want to learn/brush up on your Japanese skills.

author: {'steamid': '76561198997082941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1882, 'last_played': 1668086962}
review: It was relly helpful and a fun way to learn a little bit of japanese language

author: {'steamid': '76561198043104683', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1613385952}
review: I don't remember how I got this, probably in a Humble Bundle. I got the card drops, then decided to play it, and honestly it's an RPG Maker game that's too long. I already learned this stuff through other means in a few days and that still took less time than how long it took for me to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199124559093', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1613160446}
review: Very simple RPG system and graphics (similar to Pokemon in terms of style and play) so its easy to control, use, and understand. It has 5 save file slots so you can play and other people can also play without having to overwrite a previous save, but also gives you a good description and walks you through what you'll be learning. It tells you how to pronounce(and write the pronunciation for) each character, write the hiragana for the character, and what it translates to in English. It also gives you the option to listen to the pronunciation and see the way character is written as many times as you need. Its very nice and the game covers pretty close to everything you need to know about hiragana. I would absolutely recommend this to other people that are looking for a more fun play like way of learning Japanese while also getting all the information they need.

author: {'steamid': '76561199017003132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1613083928}
review: pretty good for learning basics, especially if it's on sale :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198273262810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1591572491}
review: okay but not worth the $

author: {'steamid': '76561198404105877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 33908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20544, 'last_played': 1707692518}
review: excellent game for gamers looking to take a step into learning Japanese symbols hiragana.  It allows for the constant interaction with the symbols and recalling what each means in order to solidify the idea into the mind.   Furthermore the game is fun with a nice story line and side quest for a language learner to keep interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088167957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1610644279}
review: First and foremost, I recommend this game to help you memorize hiragana quickly and with relative ease. I DO RECOMMEND A NOTEBOOK! write stuff down and practice the characters to help solidify them in your memory. I also recommend finding digital flashcards. Those helped me too but everyone learns in a different way. And this might not be your way. However, this game helped ME memorize and be able to read all the hiragana characters in less than twelve hours! (Some of this play time is from when I tried the game a while ago). Yes, the game isn't a marvelous game. The game itself doesn't have anything amazing going for it. But as a tool to help you learn, I give it ten out of ten. This really streamlined the learning and it made me feel like I wasted so much time trying to learn these characters on my own from books. Highly recommend if you're looking to start learning the Japanese language.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044003624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1612240152}
review: Taught me the entire Hiragana alphabet, but you'll need to study on your own. Either make your own note cards, or find a decent note card app for your phone and study when you have some off time, like on a lunch break during work. It's so cool learning a second language and being able to recognize some words and characters

author: {'steamid': '76561198139271741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1612134210}
review: Great study resource for a Japanese class. While the RPG aspects are super-plain, the educational content is presented very well, and that's what counts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258602074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1612770872}
review:
A clever one, where you have no other choice but to learn - you'll see what I mean when you play it, but it's reaaaallllyyy clever done >:D
And you know, it's actually one of those games where you learn -
and I learnt in 3 hours just as much as I learnt in Duolingo in 4 months

And here it's actually fun + with a nice story
Screw Duolingo, play this here

author: {'steamid': '76561198036075924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1611883572}
review:
I am genuinely surprised at how good this game is. This is my first time learning Hiragana, and I played this game while simultaneously starting duolingo. It really showed me how mediocre duolingo is! The music is pretty good, story is fine, art is fine. It's really effective at helping you learn the hiragana in an organized way. The gameplay is passable. It's a bit tedious to play for long periods of time, but it's better to play a game like this a section a day anyway to better remember the words.

Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198290817537', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1627174086}

author: {'steamid': '76561199073417695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1611600634}
review: This was interesting to say the least. This game does it's job decently, which is teaching hiragana. Though that's about all it does really; the story was quirky to say the least, the music was forgettable for me, but I really enjoyed all the music for the final dungeon. Needless to say, if you're looking for a generally good game, don't get this, but if you want to learn one of the Japanese writing systems and a few words in Japanese, then go for it. After all, the only thing you will lose by playing this game is ten hours and a few bucks, but that's it really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027530019', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1611604982}
review:
TLDR; This game sucks but since I learned how to read and write the full set of Hiragana (and a few japanese words) by spending roughly half an hour a day for 2 weeks together with writing flash cards and repeating them twice a day, it cannot be so bad.

Pro:
* Learning Hiragana the fun way by playing a video game feels great
* I liked the soundtrack
* I really loved fighting the [spoiler]Romanji and vocabulary warriors[/spoiler]
* Getting to know how to write the Hiragana through an animation was also quite helpful

Cons:
* The level design is annoying most of the time (although I liked the two temples near the end of the game)
* Always fighting the same groups of Hiragana warriors in one dungeon makes you remember the groups not the characters. Some variation would have been great (Especially in the dungeon after I learned や、ゆ and よ) and I would have liked to fight Hiraganas from previous lessons more often.
* I often had technical issues. Either the game crashed or the sound went missing while playing or the sound was not even there when starting the game (changing to compatibility mode helped a bit). Maybe I should add, that I played the game on a Convertible which surely does not offer the best performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040589537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1611455223}
review: A lot of repetition, but that is what helps set concepts in mind.  The inventory system is overly simplistic, but it does a good job of showing how to draw the individual hiragana.  Has kept me interested for 20+hours and increased my ability to read hiragana more than any other method I've tried so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079456651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1610877186}
review: If you any interest at all in learning Japanese, then this game is a great place to start. By the end of the game, you will have learned every Hiragana kana and even a few basic phrases. I personally had already learned Hiragana before I really got into this game. However, this game was quite beneficial to me as well because it forced me to actively remember what I had learned. Overall, this is a great little game that can be completed in around 10 hours. I highly recommend picking this game up if you have a few extra bucks lying around and want to learn some basic Japanese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082903822', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1636958778}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992591634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1610748527}
review:
This is probably a good start to the Japanese language, but in terms of learning, I feel the game is too bare bone. It gets by teaching the Hiragana characters, but as the game progresses you don't start learning basic phrases till the end. 

In terms of gameplay, boy oh boy, it requires a lot of work. It would have been nice there are four characters on the screen and when you choose which to attack they correspond to them on the screen instead of having か on the top right placement but when you choose to attack か, it's on the bottom right.

In the end it's the little things, I think I've learn a little Japanese and it did its work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044321956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1610687538}
review:
If you're trying to learn Hiragana but can't seem to get into it or having a hard time remembering it, this game is for you! Having beaten the game, I'd say it's worth every penny potentially gives you a better learning experience than a basic Hiragana book purchased from a store. It teaches you some basic words and vocabulary, as well as some nuances with the character particles, however it doesn't go into too much detail since it's mostly centred around memorising the 71 characters and what they stand for. 

As for the RPG experience, I'm surprised the final boss is a lot easier to beat than getting to him. Overall easy to play that you'd probably only use a few healing potions throughout the entire thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317315671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1610668063}
review: Very helpful. Comes with some vocabulary and a little bit of grammar at the end

author: {'steamid': '76561198000958341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1612013926}
review:
Honestly, a great learning tool. Have fully completed the game now, and absolutely loved the way the game ended.
It had all battles written in hiragana, entire words towards the end so you can learn those too, and to be honest, they really stick in your head. I learn things in a very silly way, for example, I remember the word さかな (Sakana) meaning fish, as Suck on a fish. But remember it how ever you like, the game will teach you fairly simple words that it will expect you to know for the final battles of the game.
Just some of the words it teaches you; 
あなた
とり
えんぴず
ございます
おりがと
こにちわ
せんせい
いぬ
ねこ
 The list goes on, but you'll be expected to know a fair amount of them towards the end of the game, and especially on the final "boss". 100% recommend for people who struggle with memory like myself, as this really drove it into my head, along with the 30 minute hiragana song on youtube. For £5 this is a steal of a learning tool, and this is a great use of RPGmaker. 
Now that Hiragana is out of the way, time to learn and play Katakana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039051868', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1524042828}
review:
I absolutely love this game and it has embedded the knowledge of Hiragana into my soul!!!
Also check out Warlordzen's guide as it covers everything if like me you like to complete a game completely.

I Thoroughly praise sleepyduck for their conquest into teaching language through a fun game with it's own story to tell :D
I'm currently going through katakana war and will then move onto kanji combat!

author: {'steamid': '76561198356213765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1610339299}
review:
Hiragana is a great study tool and has its own wacky story. I've personally been learning Japanese so I already knew most, if not, all of the topics that were in the beginning. I've only gotten about 3 hours into this game, so I'm still at the beginning, but I will say it has helped me remember the hiragana, so a major turn on there. 

I pretty much live stream this to my friend on discord and we have a blast. He isn't interested to learn Japanese but we have fun talking about Japan, it's culture and etiquette, and the language itself. 

Also, writing animation is smooth AF. 

Anyway, I would recommend someone this game. It's cheap, and at the time I got it, it was on sale. You can obviously see that it uses the basic game maker template at first, but it still has a certain game play style and charm to it. As of writing, it seems paying 69 cents for the trilogy seems promising. I might make other reviews for the other games and update on here. 

And if my Japanese friend is reading this, thanks for inspiring me. I'll get you back after you cursed at me in Japanese that one time!! (JK tho, you're cool! Thanks for everything bud!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198098196293', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1599998827}
review: I love that so far! Art and characters is nice and the game isn't only about learning Japanese, it's something more and deep. I'm willing to complete the game and overall this project feels natural and entertraining!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116110493', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1610056523}
review:
It should be clear that this is not a good RPG game but a study aid.

After this game I can say I learned all Hiragana, some words and phrases and a little grammer. Hiragana are the Japanese syllabary with it you should be able to pronounce every word if it written in Hiragana.

As said the RPG aspect is nothing special but it is not boring or feels poorly designed.
If you want to start to learn Japanese or are struggling with boring lectures give this game a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098784531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1609899860}
review:
Hiragana battle is good to ingrain hiragana in your head, but there are some caveats.

I am reviewing this as someone who now has memorised all hiragana, and I started with this game, that being said, I think this is not a good tool to learn hiragana, but instead to further memorise what you already know. 

In terms of game-play, as all the other reviews echo, the game is perfectly serviceable. Everything is meh. Don't expect much of a story, stellar game-play or a great soundtrack. In terms of difficulty you can expect it to range from slightly difficult at the most strenuous times to a cakewalk. I don't see this as negative because anybody who is looking at this game probably cares much more about the educational aspect than how fun it is.
 
From the perspective of learning hiragana, (Obvious warning, this is my anecdotal experience) I would try to memorise the hiragana, stroke order etc, and write it down on paper as the game suggested. However, when it actually came to the game-play I found there were a few major hurdles that make the game pretty inefficient. 

The biggest problem is that the game doesn't actively make you draw out the hiragana in any way. You see the hiragana, click on the corresponding sounds it makes, and win. As the brain is fundamentally lazy and looks for shortcuts, I found I wasn't really learning the hiragana at all, instead I remembered the general shape of the hiragana, so I'd remember "me" is a circle with a line inside of it, and "A" is a cross and detached circle. The only exception to this would be like "Nu" and "Me" as they're so similar. This system is fine for recognizing shapes in-game, but I couldn't write out any hiragana if I had a gun to my head. Add to this that you'll often deal with the same sets of hiragana, it's not randomized. In this way, I found I wasn't really learning hiragana beyond the overall shape. 

Second, while there are occasionally moments in the game where you have to produce hiragana, I found that I memorised the position of what each hiragana was, thanks again to my lazy brain. (Ex. The 2nd set of hiragana are the K's, and it always goes a i e o u, so the 3rd is Ke.) It's a shame it's like this. If there were an option to scramble the hiragana in the menu then this would be solved quite easily.  

Because of this, I stopped mid-way, learned hiragana through workbooks and robokana, then came back to this and finished the game. I think it helped me to use and apply the knowledge of hiragana I learned from workbooks, and so I think it's still worth the money. It also has a decent amount of vocabulary included and a small amount of grammar which is really nice.

If I had to make any suggestion, especially if the devs were ever make another game like this, I would recommend that you must draw out the hiragana in-game with your mouse instead of selecting the sound with a menu. I picked this game up on sale for $1, and recommend waiting for a sale. But I think this game is still worth the asking price of $7 Canadian (About $5 US) if you can't wait for one. I definitely do plan on buying the katakana game, but only after I've learned it first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079582132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1610394568}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962525905', 'num_games_owned': 2424, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1614064586}
review: Been finding this really useful to learn the Hiragana glyphs. I've tried several times to learn the Japanese alphabets via more traditional means but ADHD means textbook learning is difficult at best. As a JRPG this game is unsurprisingly basic and contrived, but as a means to learn and recognise characters it really works. The repetition of a JRPG system turns "stare at this page of text" into a more engaging learning process - identify this character or lose the fight. Might not work for everyone but it's working for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127109833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1607441515}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968810923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1609161026}
review:
Decent, inexpensive study aid. The game itself is a very basic RPGmaker game where you have to identify hiragana characters in order to attack and defeat them. The progression through the hiragana syllabary is reasonably paced, introducing five characters at a time (plus dakuten). Writing the characters is not part of the gameplay, but the stroke order is shown and the player is encouraged to practice on paper. Some introductory vocabulary is also taught, though it is not the focus of the game.

However, the game mechanics have not been polished to work well with this premise, meaning menuing attacks is a chore, offensive magic is non-existent, and "overkill" attacks are simply wasted (since they will hit a non-matching character). Also, aside from the different characters identifying them, enemies within a given area are pretty much identical and all have the same attacks. The enemies within the encounters are also not randomized: there are just a few predetermined sets of enemy characters, and after spending any amount of time in a given area, groups of enemies will start looking familiar, which is not great for learning.

Level design is also rather tedious. Frequently, you will reach the end of a map, only to discover you need an item at the other end, forcing you to backtrack. Worse, you cannot even pick up the item until you've already reached the obstacle that requires it to pass. Furthermore, encounters happen randomly and do not even stop happening after an area is "cleared," resulting in exploration becoming truly obnoxious. At least it's easy to flee battles, but that sort of defeats the game's purpose.

The economy is also poorly paced. There is no point in buying weapons past the first tier since you will find better ones before you can afford upgrades. Money is much better spent on armor, the top tiers of which will make you basically invincible.

This game needs a remake to bring it up to the level of the subsequent games, which are still RPGmaker games but have largely fixed the above issues. You do not have to play this game first to play the subsequent games, so if your hiragana skills are already pretty good, skip this one and move on to Katakana War or Kanji Combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561199049790103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3975, 'last_played': 1607361810}
review: all learn japanese games are good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263625706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1657130032}
review:
This Game is in itself really good for what it's trying to do

you learn the Hiragana Characters and you defeat those with what you've learned about them

The story is obviously not the moste serious and at some point a real Laughing stock but it does the Job. 

My only negative, as an advice for the Developer, is following.

try to balance the Amount of characters you have to fight during each section.

It is a good way to fight the characters how you do to memorize them more but it's not good if you encounter some Characters 10 times while don't meet some of the others at all.

I for one already learned some basic japanese privately so i don't have that much issues but if you start that game as a total beginner it will actively influence your ability to memorize certain characters especially if you seriously want to learn the Language.

other then that its does it's Job really well so 8/10 for what it wants to be

author: {'steamid': '76561198062165805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1608956793}
review:
If I had to describe this game in one word it would be "tedious.” 

[b]The dungeons are tedious.[/b]
The game frequently features locked doors that require backtracking to get the key or whatever Mcguffin to unlock the forward path. It's more annoying when you know it's coming, but can't push the button or find the key until you check that the door is locked. It's a lazy way to pad the gameplay and it's made even worse by all the random encounters along the way. I suppose you could argue in this case that more random encounters means more chances for learning the hiragana characters, but....

[b]The random encounters are tedious.[/b]
Random encounters are normally pretty tedious, but this game makes them even slower than a normal RPGs because only the correct answer "attack" will do any damage, so you have to scroll through an ever expanding list of characters as you progress. You are going to want to have "command remember" on in this game and possibly use a mouse instead of the arrow keys so you can somewhat limit all the scrolling you'll have to do. I can't come up with a better solution, but having to scroll through 46 characters and their variations, but it's annoying when you have to do it for four heroes.

To make matters worse the hiragana warriors are not lined up the same on the battlefield as they are in the sub-menus. Pressing down on the enemy list takes you to the right on the field and pressing right in the menu takes you down on the field. I’m not sure if this is an RPG Maker quirk or design flaw specific to this game. When you kill an enemy, if other heroes were going to attack that enemy, they will use their readied attacks on the next available enemy, which 100% of the time results in them using the wrong attacks and zero damage, since you will not encounter more than one of same enemy in a battle. These kinds of mistakes may eventually diminish as you progress and learn which heroes are faster, which are stronger and how much HP the enemies generally have, but this could have been remedied if the game simply displayed enemy HP so you don't overkill on enemies.

These two things often lead to the player fumbling the correct answer on the wrong enemy resulting in a wasted turn of no damage and unnecessary confusion, which takes you out of the game and out of learning mode.


[bSmall complaints:[/b]

Equipment
I personally never earned enough yen from the battles to even afford the second tier of weapons for all the characters, before I was handed the third tier for free by one of the dungeons, which also made the battles feel less rewarding. Also, since third tier of weapons was handed out mid-dungeon it made the issue with overkilling enemies more prevalent until I re-learned how strong the characters were.

Vocabulary words
The game teaches vocabulary, but it often teaches words that contain kana the player has not yet learned. Furthermore, most of the words taught are shown in a mishmash of romaji and hiragana. This is not good for someone learning the kana for the first time. While teaching hiragana is the point of the game, the vocabulary isn’t included in the combat (only in a few side quests or NPC dialogue), so it almost seems tacked on for no real reason.


==========================

[b][u]Conclusion[/u][/b]
If you’re interested in this game because you want to learn Japanese or for a fun game experience, I would suggest looking elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145452722', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1608939017}

author: {'steamid': '76561198251156872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1637454259}
review:
Something I always try to remember, is that education is a journey, not a race. I say this because there are faster, dare I say better ways to learn Hiragana than by playing this game, people who can devote themselves to a task could easily get them learnt in a couple of weeks.

This is the way to go for everyone else. If you're anything like me, this game is a Godsend for this sort of thing. You'll learn a script or two, and some basic words and phrases, but sooner or later try to come to terms with the fact that learning Japanese, along with any language, is a lot of books and revision; you aren't going to learn it through fun little games like this. HOWEVER, not only do I find that this game is still a fantastic place to start, it's also skyrocketed my confidence that I can learn another language, I went to one of the worst schools in England at the time, and my passion for education still struggles to recover from that, but this game not only made me feel confident in learning Japanese, it made me damn well enjoy it, even the boring textbook stuff. I mean, the game starts in a snowy field, how could that *not* pull me in?

Anyone who wants to learn Japanese but doesn't know where to start, start here, this will build you a strong foundation from the ground up I promise you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205489499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1650658409}
review: Very helpful and enjoyable if you want to learn the basics of Japanese in an entertaining way :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198300747804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1607405888}
review: As an RPG it's mediocre but as a learning tool it is bound to be helpful.  It's basically a memory training device where you 'fight' hiragana symbols in rpg battle by choosing the correct translation.  The lessons are nicely set up and even show you how to write the characters if you want to start learning that too.  Realistically this is just a small first step in learning another language but it gives you some variety and a fun context to learn with.  The additional vocabulary and cultural details add as well.  Tediosity is going to be your real worst enemy in language learning so having a game to learn part of language could help you to keep at it.  The interface isn't perfect as others have mentioned but that doesn't cut into the study aspect much as you are trying to build by repetition.  Story and characters are ok but generic, don't expect the best rpg ever.  I paid less than a dollar.  Might want to wait for a sale and get all three titles if you are a serious learner.

author: {'steamid': '76561199036868815', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1607536345}
review:
Also vorab: Wer meint mit diesem Spiel kann er locker Japanisch lernen... nein leider nicht. 

Japanisch ist viel zu komplex um es so zu lernen, aber es kann helfen, ich lerne derzeit Japanisch per Busuu und da kommt mir aber das Programm gerade richtig. 

Wieso: 

Weil eine Sprache auch immer über die Schrift geht, es wie bei der Buchhaltung, die Basics müssen einfach sitzen, und Basics bei einer Sprache sind eben nun mal die Schriftzeichen, ob Hiragana oder Katakana.
Und da hilft das Spiel extremst, die Wiederholung der Schriftzeichen, es geht schnell man lernt neben dem Zocken und prägt sich besser die Schriftzeichen ein. 

Sicherlich, die Story ist ein wenig fade und es ist das Standartsetup vom RPG Maker  aber schaut einfach darüber hinweg. Ich finde es bisher klasse, gerade um Schriftzeichen zu üben, das diese besser sitzen. 

Erwartet aber keine Megastory oder das ich Zeichen schreiben könnt in dem Spiel, geht leider nur per Auswahl, aber das ist ok, sicherlich bei 75 Zeichen ist es dann schon mühsam zu suchen, aber dabei ist der Lerneffekt ja auch mit dabei. 

Ich habe mir alle 3 Teile nun für 5 Euro gesamt geschossen und dafür ist es echt ok!!.. die 5 Euro sind gut angelegt.. finde ich. Aber muss jeder selber wissen, ich benutz es gerne um meine Schriftzeichen zu Üben und zu verbessern, für den rest hab ich derzeit Busuu

author: {'steamid': '76561198045788951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1657455907}
review:
I buyed this product to learn hiragana in a funny way.
But this piece of software fails in both way, as a game and as a teaching software.

The idea to mix both, playing and learning is good, but this game fails just cause the developers didnt put any effort in the interface. They just take the provided interface the "rpg maker" provides by default, and that is a very annoying interface. 

Here are the main points what make this game unplayable and fails to be a good teaching product:

1. You learn the hiragana syllables in little tutorials, and these tutorials have no repeating mode which ask you the new learned hiraganas, until your error rate goes under a specific value.
You learn by repeating and there is no switch in the tutorials or in the very short test that follows to do that repeated learning.

2. After you learned some hiraganas you go on mission where you fight against monster hiraganas. You have to fight them by selecting the right romaji (which describes how to spell a hiragana with latin letters). 
And this is the biggest negative point in this game. For example you see a か monster and now have to fight it with the right "ka" attack. So you have to choose this attack out of a list of 
5 in Level 1
15 in Level 2
25 in Level 3
(this will go up to ~75)
And with level 3 all the fun is gone cause you have to search the right attack out of an big list. There i stop to play this game. That is slow and not funny. Where is the point to play a learning game that has no fun.
I decided to use raw learning websites that ask you over and over again for the correct answer and see my success rate rising over 90% was more fun that the game. And that with less time. With ~30 minutes a day i learned the first 35 hiraganas (inc. dakuten) in 3 days with ~88% hit rate.
It really needs an interface where you can type in the right answer instead selecting it out of a list.

3. They dont support the learning rate with playing the vocal sound when you fight the hiraganas. With playing the sound you would be able to learn faster and learn the right spelling of it by the way. And the sound quality of the spoken hiraganas is not good at all.

Cannot recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043821953', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1605977742}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984872411', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1605570643}
review: This game, while a modestly developed JRPG (looks to be made using some type of RPG Maker-style software), is very educational and a very helpful tool if you are ever interested in learning Japanese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364545558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1606472808}
review: Great game but it became a little rushed at the end. The content creators clearly realized including a bit of vocabulary and specially grammar basics can significantly help the learners to get a grasp of the big picture and inspire players to further study Japanese on their own. However it was a bit too late (just before the final boss) to introduce the grammar stuff and the vocab lessons were clearly designed as low priority side quests so to me it seemed like a missed opportunity. Aside from this point, the game is fun and informative and I'm definitely gonna try the Katakana war. Hopefully there will be more grammar and vocab lessons there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159426714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1610460602}
review:
A fun way for beginners to get a handle on Japanese hiragana and learn some basic vocabulary along the way. The tutorials are excellent, going over each character and how to write it. They also provide some basic vocabulary, along with "side quests" to help you practise it. 

For the main missions, you have to find various objects to complete an area, while facing random battles against "hiragana warriors" along the way. The way to beat these "warriors" is to correctly identify them - a fun way to learn and really drill the characters into you. You have four "allies" who take turns attacking the "warriors" and can be attacked in turn (there are various weapons and cures to help your "allies"). If I have one complaint about these battles, it's not always very clear to me which "ally" is supposed to attack which "warrior". Quite often I will correctly identify a character, but the "ally" will attack the wrong "warrior". It's most irritating.

Still, if you want to get started in Japanese, this is not too shabby an introduction. Of course, you need to learn the katakana and kanji once you've mastered the hiragana, but these guys have made companion games for that! They have all the bases covered. I reckon by the time you're done, you should be able to read Japanese hiragana quite proficiently and be able to say at least some basic phrases. So it's a great way to start, or a handy supplement to an existing course (I use it in conjunction with Duolingo's Japanese course). So also worthwhile as a study aid if you're doing a beginner course elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201528455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1605197619}
review: Having already known Hiragana, this was a bit slow paced in its teaching of the characters, but for a beginner, I think this pace is really good. In the matter of about 10 hours I beat the game, so I'd say maybe around 15 hours to learn hiragana by this method? Which is pretty good, if you ask me. It also gives you vocab and very minor grammar points. A good place to start off, if you need an RPG maker game to help you study or recap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136430622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1615210584}
review: This game is incredible. I'm a student at university doing a year abroad in Japan, and it's so invaluable. For the last 8 weeks I've been struggling to learn the hiragana- "I'm bored, it's boring, bugger it lets go watch suits on Netflix". I'm not good at motivating myself to do boring things. This game feels like I'm cheating- I've memorised nearly all the hiragana in about eight hours. I went to sleep last night, woke up and I still had them memorised. The vocab sections are amazing too. I can't wait to do this with katakana and kanji. I'm way ahead of the rest of my Japanese class simply because of this one game. It's incredible. Best purchase I've ever made and I could not recommend a game more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001679105', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 560, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1604501716}
review:
Le jeu vidéo est le meilleur moyen, (avec la musique selon moi) d’apprendre une autre langue.

Le fait que le jeu soit en Anglais est vraiment gênant mais empêche en rien de profiter du jeu en apprenant une nouvelle langue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084076229', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1689885407}
review:
Quer aprender o básico de japonês? Ou melhor, memorizar cada Hiragana que existe, mas acha maçante os métodos de estudo? Porque seus problemas acabaram! Esse jogo serve muito bem para se acostumar com Hiragana e também te dá o básico de vocabulário para começar a aprender japonês! 
O jogo é um RPG em que as batalhas você e sua party luta contra "Hiragana warriors" ou os kanas. Ganhar experiência nesse jogo é menos um ciclo repetitivo desgastante, pois você está treinando sua mente com as batalhas, aprendendo cada vez mais Hiragana.
Estou na terceira semana estudando Hiragana e Katakana, o primeiro nível já está completo. Até o final do jogo estarei com cada kana no sangue! E sempre vou poder voltar ao jogo para mais.
OBS.: Vale a pena pegar os três jogos juntos, o de Katakana e o Kanji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041331871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1605034394}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084195596', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1603969512}
review: Surprisingly fun rpg. went in with 0 hiragana experience finished the game in 16 hours and am confident I can read and  remember 90% of hiragana characters easily. the repetitive nature of rpgs means you'll be spending plenty of time with each character to remember them, and each set of characters has its own location you can revisit if you need a reminder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073816937', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1604859910}
review:
So... I'm gonna start by saying that I'm a person who learned a bit of Japanese before. However, the alphabets don't really stick to me and I was hoping to find a way to force them into my brain using something more fun than flashcards (ugh). Well...

4 hours into this game and I went to my wishlist and removed other titles from this series. 

It's bad. Frustrating. And it distracts you from learning with bad design choices. 

Look, initial lessons are done quite okay, it's done 5 signs at a time, in order, you can see how they are written and what sound they make. Cool. Then you go off on an adventure, right? Technically, yes, but, my dog, that is a one turd of an adventure. 

[u]Premise[/u] is boring - a bad guy shows up, does damage, you have to learn Japanese to defeat him. Written like could seem potentially okay. But its delivery in-game is not. I literally couldn't be more disinterested after the initial scenes. And store page has the audacity to say "exciting story". LOL. 

[u]Characters[/u] are boring. I don't even remember their names and I stared at those for quite a while now. 

[u]Jokes[/u] are boring too. There was one (literally one) dialogue so far, that made me smile but for whatever reason I can't take screenshots in game, so it's gone forever. And I don't even remember now what it was about, so probably nothing worthwhile. 

[u]Fights.[/u] This is my main criticism. Fights are extremely tedious. EXTREMELY. To attack an enemy once you need to 
1. select the hero
2. select if they attack or do other things
3. select the enemy hiragana sign
4. select the right sound that sign makes from a long list
5. accept
All that for one hero to attack a sign once. It wouldn't be too bad in a regular j-rpg style game, where these attacks can really vary and stuff, sure. But this game is supposed to teach you an alphabet and I can surely think of better ways to direct focus towards learning, instead of "try not to missclick in the menu while doing the same steps four times". 
Imagine how nice it would be if there would be only three steps: 
1. select the hero
2. Select attack
3. [b]type in[/b] the sound using your [b]keyboard[/b]. 
Revolutionary, I know, using the keyboard like that. It would improve the gameplay 100% and maybe I wouldn't be so annoyed with it.  

All the enemies are the same - so, hiragana. Their attacks don't really differ, it all falls flat and becomes boring very very early in the game.

Fights happen all the time. You enter the location - there are chests you want to reach and a passage north. Every few steps, a fight. Even worse, I reached all the chests, fought countless fights, reached the passage only to learn I need wood to build a bridge over it. And that I can get wood on the other side of that location (so basically, backtrack to the entrance). I try to do that and after two steps... a fight again. That was a spot where I ragequitted for the day. And let me tell you, these fights are not getting better, further in the game. 

Enemies don't have health bars!!!!!! Game, what the hell. How am I supposed to fight when I don't know enemies health, order of the attacks during the turn, anything useful? It wasn't a rare occasion when I scheduled attacks to defeat one sign and it died after the first and the rest of the attacks went to waste. However you square it, stripping gameplay of important information for no reason is just bad user experience. 

[u]Equipping items[/u]? Yeah, this is bad on its own. It should be transparent and easy to manage. It is not. 

[u]Game speed[/u]
Everything in game is SLOW. Animations are slow and unskippable, choosing any items or attacks is unnecessarily complicated, some of dialogues and quests are really redundant and only slow you down even more. 

[u]Pet peeve[/u]: game teaches you keyboard setting that doesn't work (like it cues WASD for walking but only arrows work) 

--

I don't feel I'm any close to finishing this game but I guess I'll have mercy on myself this time. It really makes flashcards and duolingo lessons [b]interesting[/b] and [b]fresh[/b]. Go figure. 

Also, by the way, I think that out of all these hours I've spent in-game, maybe 15% of it had anything done with Japanese. The rest is walking, fight's menu, managing items and boring dialogue. And none of that is appealing in the slightest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077399574', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1633814240}
review: Nice way to learn the basics of Hiragana and a few words.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018117897', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1603753596}
review:
While the Japanese Lessons are actually pretty good, the gameplay surrounding it is not so great. It plays like your standard rpg-maker game, but I find it has very little depth or fun to it. The gameplay is actually [b]so[/b] monotonous that it manages to distract me from the lessons themselves. 

Learn Japanese to Survive can be an ok learning tool if you manage to ignore the boring gameplay, but I personally really could not do that. I want to learn Hiragana, but I can't really learn much of anything when the gameplay almost puts me to sleep. Also keep in mind that this game is more for beginners than anything else. You learn Hiragana and some basic words, but that's about it. It's a very good start, but not much more. 

However, I don't think this is a completely garbage game. In fact I actually think this is a pretty good game overall, especially for beginners! It's not perfect or spectacular, but for the most part it's definitely pretty nice. It's just the monotonous gameplay that ruins the experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195401523', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1597588878}

author: {'steamid': '76561198249454456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1604616531}
review: The main things about this game is using repetition to memorize the hiragana symbols.  I believe it is more effective using apps that you can get on your phone.  With that being said, I like that they incorporated a game into this and enjoyed the little explanations for each symbol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198832119803', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1603749910}
review: Don't go into it expecting an amazing RPG experience, it's pretty bare-bones in terms of story and design. But that's absolutely not the point of the game. As a fan of the genre, the RPG approach was engaging enough to keep me playing and was a really fun way to learn. The game is broken up well into digestible chunks so you build your knowledge base without it ever feeling too overwhelming. I'll definitely be continuing the series to learn Katakana and Kanji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035471130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1533841454}

review: I already completed the kanji game of this series when I decided to get some back story. For me there wasn't much this game could offer in the way of learning ability. I did enjoy the story and seeing a character that is in the 3rd game and gaining some back story on her. I also got a handful of vocab words I hadn't come across before which was nice. This is perfect for someone wanting an entry level study game into Japanese. It makes it fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991287557', 'num_games_owned': 1786, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1600909560}
review: Really great start to jump into learning the Japanese language and Hiragana Alphabet. Will definitely play the other games in this series once I am done with this. Just remember this is more of additional aid in learning the language and won't teach you everything or even really that much but will get you started and solidify your mastery of Hiragana!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164759395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1545068451}
review:
Perfectly to start learning the japanese alphabet!
Note that leveling is a must in order to not die easily, but that is good since it will help you remember the hiragana symbols more thouroughly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965186284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1600610067}
review:
Although certainly no expert in Japanese, I already knew Hiragana quite well before starting this game. I haven’t had any real practice of it in a long time though, so I felt like running through this game would be a good refresher and I was curious at how long it would take me.

That was just under five and a half hours, which included all the side quests the game offers. The in-game timer is greatly inaccurate though, showing double that.

As much of my previous experience with Japanese was from Slime Forest Adventure, a very similar Japanese learning RPG, I can’t help but compare this game to it.

A substantial issue I had with this game is that it’s running on an RPG Maker engine, which really showed some limitations of building this type of learning game around it. In Slime Forest, when needing to enter an answer, you simply typed it from your keyboard. This game though, you constantly are needing to scroll through menus for the attack you want.

It’s made worst as each party member keeps a history of their last attack. Although generally what you would want in a usual RPG, I felt it was more of an annoyance here. While playing, I did gradually become used to it though.

The whole RPG element makes this far more of a game then an educational tool, finding Slime Forest to provide a much better learning experience. In particular, the random battles here are exactly that; random. There’s no attempt to focus you on what needs improvement, and there’s also a factor of managing an entire party, rather than focusing on the Hiragana itself.

On a positive note, despite using templated assets, the graphics were nice, along with decent music. There’s a story but it’s very generic, along with its characters, not that you would expect otherwise on a game like this.

Overall though, I can’t recommend this as a learning tool. Slime Forest is the superior Japanese learning game, having a great deal more content as well, despite the poor graphics and lack of sound. Unfortunately, it doesn’t hold up much better as a game either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063431965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1600411871}
review: Definitely an easy to digest the very basics of Hiragana. This is in no way a substitute for actual practice and use of actual learning materials, but if you want to get started and play a simple/easy game at the same time, go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198385666083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1599678647}
review:
Bon. Pour une question de préférence, j'ai commencé par les kanjis (la fin, en terme de jeu). Du coup, j'évalue mieux les forces et faiblesses de cette séquence.

[b]L'histoire[/b] est vraiment peu crédible (tout particulièrement un certain plan d'attaque ennemie), mais reste l'élément le moins important.

[b]Viabilité technique et mécanique de jeu[/b]
Un seul crash sur l'ensemble de la partie, yatta ! Réel soulagement par rapport au dernier-né qui m'obligeait à sauvegarder à l'issue de chaque combat (même vieux PC, Windows 10 x64).
Il y a quelques défauts du côté de l'interface, les maps sont trop grandes et les random encounters pénibles... ce qui est réglé dans l'opus des kanjis. Merci aux joueurs pour les retours et développeurs pour les correctifs ! Les groupes d'ennemis sont peu variés (et le resteront, mais passons).

[b]Pédagogie[/b]
Je ne suis pas fana de l'hiragana et reste un peu fâchée avec, mais ce jeu m'a aidée à faire un premier pas vers la réconciliation. Il est plus que dommage que les syllabes et mots ne soient pas lus afin d'aider à la mémorisation, dans ce premier volet.

En bref, le bundle soldé ne mange pas de pain - le prix d'une baguette ou deux, à la réflexion ! -, vous serez servi si vous cherchez une étape préliminaire aux manuels et dictionnaires bilingues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004842640', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1605634321}
review:
Jogo simples, tanto no visual como na história, mas muito eficiente naquilo que se propõe a fazer. 

O foco obviamente é o hiragana, mas também tem lições interessantes focadas em vocabulário e comunicação/conversação. 

Muito amigável para iniciantes no estudo da língua. 

Certamente comprarei a versão katakana em seguida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037050975', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1599230878}
review:
Дружба начинается с улыбки, а японский — с хираганы! Эта учебная игра действительно помогает выучить хирагану. И если даже не писать, то хотя бы читать.
Что бы не только выучить хирагану, но и следить за сюжетом игры, требуется знать английский язык. Но даже без него игра очень помогает выучить хирагану. Я вот с английским не очень дружу, поэтому пропускаю все сюжетные диалоги, но хорошо прорабатываю упражнения, которые попадаются. Запоминание символов хираганы происходит во время битвы с этими самими символами. Я советую никогда не сбегать с битвы, даже если вы уже отлично выучили попавшиеся символы.
А для лучшей отработки и запоминания символов, я бы посоветовал для каждого символа выучить по два слова, в которых этот символ встречается.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210728903', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1598967623}

author: {'steamid': '76561198348309309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1598783729}
review:
For me, the concept of the game doesn't work. You always start in a classroom, learn some new characters / words and than you have to fight the characters. That's all.

This game is only about memorizing. You don't practice to read and to write. But practice is the most important part, if you want learn a language. For this you don't need a game, an app, etc. . For memorizing a list with all characters and words is enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105034993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1610984519}
review:
I learned more from the first few hours of this game than I did from months of Duolingo. I'm not sure if that means this game is really good or just that I suck at learning from Duolingo, but either way this game really helped me. It goes through all the Hiragana characters, generally about 5 at a time, explaining how they are used and how to write them. You then get plenty of revision by fighting Hiragana enemies you have to defeat by correctly identifying them. There are also plenty of side-quests that teach you vocabulary - for instance, one side quest teaches you the names of food in a cafe and how to order them - and a lot of the writing for the side quests is legitimately hilarious. I won't spoil any of the jokes, but I laughed out loud at a fair few of them.
The game plays like old-school Dragon Quest, right down to the little details like the little musical chime that plays when you rest at an inn, and as a long-time fan of Dragon Quest this made it lots of fun to learn Japanese. I didn't view playing the game as work, it was something I did for enjoyment.
The only thing you really need to remember before you buy the game is to make sure you have pens and paper with you, take notes on everything you learn, and constantly revise your notes. Play this daily, and you'll have Hiragana memorised in no time! Then you can move on to Katakana... then Kanji... Oh God, the Kanji...

author: {'steamid': '76561198306015037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1597457405}
review: This game has been really helpful in getting me to actually memorize hiragana. I've wanted to learn Japanese for years, but it's easy to forget to study when there isn't a memorable and engaging way to do so. If I were to make one suggestion it would be that the developers try to fix one of the lessons of phrases. It lists "Africa" as a country under the phrase "Watashi wa Amerika jin desu". Africa is a continent and not a country so simply changing it out for a country in Africa (Like South Africa, Ethiopia, or any of the other nations of the world's second largest continent) seems like it should be a simple fix, though I am no game designer so maybe I'm wrong. Regardless, I do highly recommend this game to anyone like me who simply wants to learn the language, but finds the process of memorizing alphabets to be tedious or forgettable. The game also tries to include very helpful basic vocabulary and phrases making it a great starting point (especially if you're not sure where to start with learning vocabulary or grammar).

author: {'steamid': '76561197996115754', 'num_games_owned': 1212, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1597437238}

author: {'steamid': '76561198425335528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1597400249}
review:
Un excelente juego para aprender hiraganas. Usa muy bien el factor repetitivo del grindeo a su favor para que así puedas memorizarlos de forma más eficiente. Además, me encanta el toque de que el juego no se limita a solo enseñarte hiraganas, sino que también te enseña expresiones típicas de Japón, como los diferentes saludos, las palabras usadas de forma cotidiana, ¡y hasta un poco de la cultura del país!

Se nota que a este juego le pusieron empeño para que fuese un recurso eficiente de enseñanza que se esconde bajo el manto de un género habitual pero amado de los videojuegos. ¡Muy recomendado si estás empezando a aprender japonés y necesitas una forma divertida de aprenderlo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995499840', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1582836476}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198336618373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1597188317}
review:
The concept of learning Hiragana through a RPG is a good one, but a number of design choices makes playing this very clunky in practice. The UI in particular is very outdated and clunky. 

For example, most of the game consist of you fighting enemies by matching the correct phonetics to the Hiragana, but the only option is to pick through a menu to find the right words. There is no search option nor an option to type the answer. This makes the game more and more tedious to play as you pick through an ever longer menu to pick the right answer. 

It's baffling UI design choices like this that makes the game frustrating to play. I would Avoid unless you have a lot of patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996555478', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1597112860}
review:
Too slow paced if you're already familiar with hiragana. Too focused on teaching by writing. Too many clicks to get through a battle so it feels like a chore. It doesn't even really work well as a revision tool. There are better free resources on the internet that teach you faster and test you better. Maybe it might work if you use it along side another better learning tool, but I think the pacing kills its utility.
I'll try playing it again, but it honestly felt like the game was just wasting my time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048563162', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1681663885}
review: An educational throwback to the 16-bit RPG days. It can be a little cheesy at times, and could maybe use with a small explanation as to why you write characters in a specific order, but making the repetition into a game helps. I would have liked to see a sort of quiz/review mode that didn't involve wandering around trying to run into specific enemies. The RNG seems to really favor certain enemy combos. However, after only a couple of hours I've been able to at least sound out a couple shorter words/names in various anime shows, which is my primary goal: to learn enough to read signs in shows that may not have sub translations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066053937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1595292153}
review:
O jogo é bem didático e bom pra ensinar o Hiragana (escrita mais básica do japão). Você aprende no melhor estilo final fantasy, sem foco em ter um combate incrível ou uma história absurda, apenas no aprendizado de forma mais divertida. 
Infelizmente pra mim não foi o melhor formato pra aprender, mas esse jogo me deu o pontapé pra começar a aprender um novo idioma e devo isso a ele porque se a primeira impressão de um nova coisa é um jogo divertido, você vai fazer aquilo com muito prazer.
