author: {'steamid': '76561198025315047', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1470013671}
review:
Theoretically, while using this game, I am meant to be learning Japanese and having fun.
I am learning some Japanese. I am [i]not[/i] having fun.

The lesson sets are fair educational material, with voice clips and tips on writing the hiragana, which are welcome enhancements. The music is fairly good. As a game, however, Hiragana Battle combines the worst missteps of the JRPG genre into a single frustrating experience. Gameplay is clunky and slow, made up of grindy battles in which every attack can take upwards of half a dozen key strokes. You can also use the mouse, but the game isn't well-geared to that either, and you have to click on the hiragana in the tiny menus instead where they loom large on the battle screen.

Drilling the Hiragana by selecting (or better, typing) matching English syllables is a fine thought for practicing them, but every element of the interface seems designed to take as long as possible to navigate and use. Or more likely, they were the default settings of a sort of JRPG-maker program that the devs didn't bother to find a way to improve, despite the fact that they cripple the experience by inserting pointless user-unfriendliness into everything.

Quests and story progression are not special, except that they also are laden with pointless, time-consuming delays and lazy design. Obstacles appear and disappear without explanation to railroad you through puzzles and the game takes up even more of your time with unskippable dialogue and cutscenes designed to show and tell you everything obvious so that you don't get a chance to explore anything on your own. For example, there is a quest to fix the broken bridge (of course) with three nearby logs. You will know where to find them without needing to explore because if you so much as approach the bridge, for the first, second, or twentieth time, your guide NPC will helpfully and vocally wish that you had some materials to fix it with, and you get to watch the camera slowly pan over to where the logs you need to go get are, and then slowly pan back. Then when you pick them up, you are treated to an identical dialogue pop-up congratulating you on finding each individual log, despite the fact that they are right next to one another.

There is no way to skip or quicken the repetitive animations, cutscenes and dialogue boxes that quickly become extremely tiresome. There is, however, a hotkey to quit to menu without confirmation and without saving, so you can lose all your session's progress with the press, even the accidental press, of a single button.

I would love to have games help me learn, but when my blood pressure is screaming because I am too frustrated by abysmal game design to focus on anything else, I don't learn very well. Google Slime Forest for a more user-friendly and less insulting, albeit also less pretty, guide to Japanese Hiragana and Katakana, available for [i]free[/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198093220593', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1563283563}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist kein Sprachlernspiel im eigentlichen Sinne. Es ist ein RPG mit einer netten Story, liebevoll designten Charakteren und einer schönen Athmospäre. Darin ist das Sprachen lernen integriert. Und es funktioniert tatsächlich.

Jedoch muss man einsehen, dass man dass Spiel nicht an einem Tag durchzocken(sollte) kann. Sonst bleibt der Lerneffekt auf der Strecke. Außerdem sollte Papier und Stift zum lernen der SChriftzeichen immer da sein.

Trotzdem, volle Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001336326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1470149448}
review:
It took me about a month, but this game has succeeded in teaching me Hiragana. It has everything needed for learning it, and it's really well paced. It helped with learning the correct pronunciation of each character, as well as showing how to draw it, as well as showing slight variations on what we might see.

For the pacing of the game, each "chapter" would introduce about 5 new characters to remember. It would go one by one with pronunciation and how to draw the character. You really need a pencil & paper to copy it down. Once I had my next set of characters, I would save & quit, and spend a few days practicing and memorizing these characters. Once I had them memorized, I returned to the game to continue playing, where the game would use an RPG encounter system to practice what I had remembered, and I would do this without referencing my notes. This pacing worked perfectly for me.

In between, it would also show some common words, as well as some basic Hiragana grammar and special characters to know about. My notebook has 2 pages full of notes. One page for the 70 different characters, and another page for words that were taught.

It doesn't do much in teaching actual Japanese or overall grammar of Japanese, but learning how to read & write in Japanese is a very useful first step. All this is exactly as the product describes itself, and it has delivered on what it promised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045080783', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1469718201}
review:
Do you want to learn Japanese Hiragana the same way you memorise random encounters in RPGs?
This is still a educational game, so you will need to write down notes and lessons. 
The difficulty is very low, as most mobs die in 1 or 2 hits and your team usually goes first. 
If you do sidequests, you have the option to get instant level ups. 
The usable items are unnecessary, because the girls can heal and the dungeons are not long enough to run out of mana. 
The guys only get a skill at high level, if you even notice it.
It does feel like a basic RPG maker game, but the Japanese culture it presents improves it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045363722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1485867448}
review:
If you're interested in learning Japanese, but are scared of the monumental task ahead of you, this game is an excellent place to start. It's not just a gimmick, or bad JRPG with a language-teaching theme. It is a true educational tool that masterfully scales the learning from easiest to harder. You begin the game entirely in English, and the cute little story gives you enough to learn Japanese gradually to survive. Slowly you'll have gorgeous little hiragana and vocab lessons, and side quests will open that give you more Japanese teaching as a reward. Certain VERY clever events happen that require you to take little leaps with your new Japanese knowledge, but I won't spoil those for you :) 

The only downside is that the game itself is possibly a tad too hard. I would rather smash my Hiragana enemies (kindof like a battle quiz) rather than have them do bullshit attacks that damage my whole party and force me to reload areas. But just save scum often and it shouldn't be a problem! 

Ganbatte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198310944023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1469065734}
review: This game was perfect! It's been something like 10 years since i last touched up on japanese and this was a very refreshing reminder of hiragana. Because this game has many similar aspects to pokemon, I didn't have much difficulty trying to become interested in the game. I found myself trying to level up my characters for hours so I could crush the hiragana warriors. As was the case in pokemon, this process was very repetitive and annoying to do at times but it's perfect for this game. This is because while you are trying to level up, you start to recognize the characters more and more to where it almost feels like a fun version of flash cards. Of course there is still a lot to learn but this game definitely gives you a good start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140400720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1467594822}
review: personally i learnt spanish the 5 years in school and cant remember a single thing because it was simple repetition with nothing able to grab my attention and keep me interested or entertained adding to that the fact i have a poor memory i thought i would never even begin to learn japanese so when i bought this game it was out of more curiosity. now having played it for two weeks i know and can remember everything that i  have learnt on my journey through the game even though it can be abit repetetive the fact that i want to know the end and my competetive nature helps me pay more attention then i ever did in school so if your like me and have a poor memory or a shot attention span but enjoy playing games i recommend buying this game for somewhere to start when learning japanese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120779946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1523787191}
review: Игра самым педагогичным и приятным образом знакоит нас с основами одного из японских алфавитов Hirogana. Рекомендую всем любителям японской культуры, кто хотел когда-то начать изучение языка. Процесс игры неплохо выжигает в памяти иероглифы и их звучание. Имеются небольшие недостатки, связанные с фонетикой английского языка, что впрочем не удивительно и вполне компенсируется звуковыми вставками произношения отдельных звуков. Впрочем, в игре мы учим не английский язык, а японский алфавит, с чем программа вполне справляется, если следовать всем рекоммендациям. Да, игра не имеет русской локализации.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069912836', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 2106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1471315201}
review:
I like the concept. 
It gives grinding an extrinsic value that excuses the poor level design.
It's a great tool to start learning Hiragana ( + some vocab). Emphasis is on start.

Although I think it is important to recognize Hiragana in different fonts, I believe the one used in the writing animation is inappropriate. It has little curves that are superfluous and not beginner friendly to draw. The additional connections inbetween strokes that make the characters look more fancy are also misleading and confusing. It should have been more like the font in the dialogue.

There are one-time-only moments where the concept is reversed. It would have been nice if you could access these at any time. Also, it would have been good if there was an advanced dungeon with unrestrained randomness where you can encounter every enemy there is. The troups are very limited - that makes it transparent and exploitable and you won't learn effectively how to tell all kana apart.

Everything beyond the function of learning Japanese is plain and merely serviceable.
If you let that sentence sink in, you would agree that there is no point in describing the ins and outs of the inherent weak design. Just know what you want from this. 

There are a couple of bugs, so save very often. I beat it once and it crashed 8 times. I would prefer if there was an option to shut down the game from within the game.

Remember that you can scroll faster for this is heavy on menu usage.

I wouldn't buy it for 7 bucks, regardless of who you are. There are games where more work and talent were poured into but are cheaper.

review: My friend bought me this game knowing that I was Japanese... I tried... Played for about an hour and realized I wasted 1 hour of my life trying to beat this game. This game is 10/10 for those who want to learn Japanese and those who are Japanse, I recommend not to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091595412', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1472336736}
review:
This game is a great way to learn Hiragana and the basics of Japanese vocabulary. If you are interested finding an effective way for learning Hiragana then you shall not look any further as you found what you've been looking for.

Pros: 
- Fun and effective way of learning and memorizing Hiragana
- Visit different places as you may already be familiar with from other RPGs
- Awkward but hilarious fights
- A fair amount of Japanese words

Cons:
- It might be too hard at the beginning for some players
- The typical random appearance of enemies might get nerve-wracking
- No nudes (sorry to disappoint you)

To sum it up I would give this game a solid 9.9/10 (cause no game is perfect :O)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045011179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1526068219}
review: Fun way to learn a new language. I had a great time playing this game, and with a book and pen at hand, I jotted down all the symbols to learn on my own. I recommend this game to anyone who wants to learn Japanese, along with getting to slay some monsters and explore along the way. Hope there will be a new game in the same genre soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038850398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1474293056}
review: I'm on the verge moving to Japan, Tokyo, to study japanese and this game have truly saved me alot of sweat and tears. The learning curve is extremely gentle and forgiving. I've played just over 3 hours and learned more letters (that stuck) than after practicing for 2 weeks by just reading and learning from an app on my phone. The whole RPG turn based battle system is truly simple and sometimes repetitive but it adds a charm that makes you forget that you are learning and not just playing. Earning levels and new gear as a reward for learning is great. It triggers an urge to learn more and it's small sidequests about food, drinks and greetings are a fun bonus. Grab a pen and paper and try it out. Can't wait for a Katakana version which is this games only actual downside that it's not in the original content. 10/10 rated by a stupid and slow learing swede.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118802850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1467406449}
review: Ottimo per chi vuole imparare l'hiragana giocando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112780551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1468189536}
review:
It is not often that I want 17 minutes of my life back from anything, and that is certainly not the case with this game...

If you are looking for a quick and easy way to learn Japanese, you really can't go past this game. The mechanics and story line are second to none. Never before has it been so easy and fun to learn to speak fluent Japanese. The dialogue is incredible, obviously written by someone with a huge understanding and respect for the Japanese language. It is not only a perfectly made JRPG, but it is one of the best uninstall simulators on the market today.

I cannot wait for a katakana DLC, so I can enjoy butchering the language some more.

10/10 would uninstall again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179536122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1473513757}
review:
I love this game!

I play it on my Windows Tablet, I need always click the software keyboard to click the  "ESC" key, can you add a menu and cancel button  on the screen please?

author: {'steamid': '76561197985940099', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1498363536}
review:
Hay muchas maneras muy buenas de aprender japonés, y este juego es una de las mejores. Lo que más me gusta es que te enseña a cómo se escriben los caracteres Hiragana de una manera muy didáctica. Y para que se te quede fresquito y no se te olvide lo aprendido, después te hace preguntas a ver si has aprendido la lección. Y luego para rematar, te hace pelear con los guerreros Hiragana los cuales la única manera de derrotarlos es eligiendo la respuesta correcta, si no, no hay manera. O aprendes, o no te pasas el juego.

Para mi ha sido muy efectivo. A mi se me ha quedado totalmente grabado en la cabeza qué significa cada hiragana que he aprendido. Lo mejor de todo es que lo pude comprar en las rebajas con los cromos que vendí, jejeje ;-) 

Eso si, tienes que saber inglés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089662840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1468341279}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048696312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1468297135}
review:
I like the idea. Played it for a bit but it's kind of painful to sit through. The RPG elements are barebones, not that I expected Final Fantasy here, but they actually make the game a little more tedious. 

You learn your hiragana in these charming little teaching sections and then you go out and "fight" against them, which involves scrolling through a menu of all the possible pronunciations of each character and matching it with the hiragana you're up against. That list gets big very fast, by the way. Combine this with a really high encounter rate and you have a recipe for a game that craaaaaawls. 

I wish I could recommend it. I really do, but it's about as slow and tedious as...learning hiragana. HUE HUE HUE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051583983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1467047323}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049035558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1468288987}
review:
I like the game and I've been learning a lot.   

I do have 1 criticism that is a hinderance to learning. Each character you are taught is shown to you in 3 different fonts. 
1: The font in the message body
2: The font that you fight
3: The font used to show how to write the character  

Having multiple fonts isn't really a problem, but it would be nice if we had a sort of "times new roman" equivilent or a "This is how you write it with a standard pencil" font rather than the (very nice) brush strokes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272747274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1557224141}
review: This game is a lot of fun. It reminds me of the old school Final Fantasy games. It teaches you not only how to recognize the hiragana, but it also teaches you how to pronounce it and write it! This game is a fun way to learn one of the many important parts of Japanese. Thank you for this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983246938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1541307859}
review:
Awesome software to start learning Japanese from scratch, [b]9/10[/b]
even tho I have a terrible memory, this game is making me remember the characters really fast.
don't cheat, you would only cheat yourself.

[h1]pros:[/h1][list]
 [*]cute and simple style resembling old rpg's
 [*]easy and intuitive controls
 [*]simple way of practicing learned knowladge thru battles
 [*]character draw animations and description with recording of the pronounciation[/list]

[h1]cons:[/h1][list]
 [*]at low levels the battles are bit boring, having to repeat answer to the same character multiple times
 [*]battles get repetitive, but thats pretty much the purpose, as you play to learn (and repetition is the best teacher)[/list]


honestly, it would be [b]10/10[/b] if I could run this on android

author: {'steamid': '76561197960738536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1480971344}
review:
Super, macht echt spaß! Hab eigentlich gar keinen Grund japanisch zu lernen, aber wer weiss wofür man das mal gebrauchen kann :D Soll jetzt nicht so negativ klingen, aber ich schreib mal nur die paar Dinge auf, die man besser machen könnte:

- Lektionen, vor allem das Zeichnen der Buchstaben/Silben etwas besser überspringen können. Sorry, ungeduldig! Vor allem, wenn man es wiederholt.
- Evtl. noch einen extra Vokabel/Zeichen-Test mitliefern, wär schön! Man könnte auch die Phrasen, wie Guten Tag etc. die man in den Sidequests erhält mit reinpacken. Weil die Story hört ja im Prinzip mit den Zahlen auf und die paar Wörter die danach kommen, sind ja in der Reihenfolge immer gleich. Und die Reihenfolge in den Lektionen auch.
- Die Gefahr besteht, dass man das nur optisch "auswendig" lernt, weiß nicht wie man das besser ausdrücken kann, weil man ja nur Knöpfe drücken muss, ohne sich Gedanken machen zu müssen, wie man es ausspricht, schreibt etc. Man könnte bei der Attacke die Kämpfer ihre Laute mit aussprechen lassen, oder auch Übungen mit reinbauen, bei denen man die Buchstaben mit der Maus zeichnen muss, statt nur zu klicken. Bietet sich ja vor allem in der "Paralleldimension" an. So mal als Idee. Die Soundfiles sind jedenfalls ja eh schon da. Oder wurde das bereits verworfen? Könnte man ja auch einstellen, falls es zu nervig wird.
- Mehr Abwechslung/randomisierte Gegner. Vor allem wenn man schon weiter ist, auch mal ältere Buchstaben mit einstreuen, damit man die auch gleich wiederholt. Gut, man kann natürlich auch die alten Orte besuchen, aber man will als Spieler ja lieber die Story voranbringen als lernen :P Oder einen Modus, der mitwächst vom Schwierigkeitsgrad. Weil nach 15 Stunden, hat man eigentlich alles drauf und es wird langweilig. Vielleicht gibts ja eine weitere Geheimwelt oder Trainingsarena?
- (edit) Mit ist noch was eingefallen. Bei den ersten Vokabellektionen sind manche Buchstaben  ja noch nicht bekannt und werden in lateinischer Schrift angezeigt. Es wäre gut, wenn man die durch Hiragana ersetzen könnte, sobald man die entsprechende Lektion freigeschaltet hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035595036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1500874051}
review:
The game teaches hiragana and a few words and phrases. You will learn romaji (English letters), hiragana, and stroke order. It chunks information into sets that you can easily look up in tutorials later. If you understand the kana, you can easily escape battles and progress the quest quickly. As the story continues, the game incorporates more japanese into npc dialogue. You can always revisit an area later for more practice.  It's not timed, so you can go at your own pace. If you use a notebook, you can practice writing hiragana. 

For critics: Did you learn English with just one book? Probably not. The game operates a cheap and useful supplement to whatever learning tools you are already using. 

Con: The pronounciations are robotic, but if you are truly looking to learn Japanese, you should be listening to multiple sound sources. They same clusters of hiragana occur, but it could be helpful to people who don't know the hiragana as well. It could use more randomization of the characters. 

I recommend this game to anyone who wants to learn Japanese. I look forward to the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038743618', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1557518101}
review:
#hiragana mathblaster

Spent about 9 hours in this game and i'm feeling pretty confident with my hiragana and enjoyed the game for what it is. The pacing of the game is excellent. The rate of which new hiragana is introduced was perfect for me And if you want to grind, it's also benifical for you to practice hiragana if you're struggling, but isn't required. 

Story: Well, it's unique. I'm not going to say this is the greatest rpg story in history, but still a better story and makes more sense than FFI. Laughed a few times, got hopefull around the middle, and then the story went flat again. But it was enough to keep me to the end.

Characters: your party stays with the same 4 and gains no new party members. Considering the mechanics, more characters aren't really needed as your main four aren't really special.

Mechanics: sadly, theres a lot to be desired for an rpg. I went through the whole game using only one other move in combat other than the "attack" button, and it was the heal for grinding. hopefully in the next game, they can have some kind of magic system that does some kind of speed read or something. But the point of the game is to teach Hiragana and the game accomplishes that in a more entertaining way than writing out the characters repeatedly. 

Quests/sidequests: main quest is stop the evil plan. Sidequest usually offer a better reward for going back to a place to grind for 5-10 minutes and can sometime work on your vocab which the main story doesn't focus on till the very very end.

Overall, I feel good about my hiragana and was entertained enough by the game that I would buy the sequel for Katakana when it comes out. Would recommend if you're looking to learn hiragana and want to have a reward and evidence of your improvement along the way.

*note* I found zero bugs during the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079407678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1532276567}
review:
I've been playing non-stop for a few hours and I only have two questions:
1. When do we get the katakana version?
2. When do we get the kanji version?

To be honest, the game is pretty simple. I wish the plot was a bit more interesting. I wouldn't mind playing something like any Final Fantasy, only changing every enemy for the kanas, and being forced to fight back remembering which is which. Maybe the game plot is not the best ever (not yet), but you can't ask for wonders at this price. However, I've been practicing kanas for three hours without being bored: so the game fulfills its purpose. 
I would love to see more of these games. This has great educational possibilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081823292', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1553807729}
review: Nothing too intense. Exactly what you'd expect and hope for. A slow but well paced introduction in to the Hiragana. I would of liked some interaction between the mouse movement & script writing to help with learning the strokes, but apart from that it's a solid game/tutor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083104600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1468868565}
review:
LLevo 2 horas jugando y me gusta. Las batallas son un poco largas, ya que tienes que ir seleccionando cada vez la letra en el menú, pero como aprendizaje es muy efectivo. O aprendes las palabras, o mueres. Contra mas aprendas, mas avanzaras en el juego, ya que las equivocaciones en los combates se pagan caras.
No solo aprendes a escribirlas sino a pronunciarlas, ademas de un básico vocabulario japones.
Como juego entretenido 5/10
Como juego aprendizaje 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046601745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1467777324}
review:
[h1]A literal JRPG[/h1]

[b]I'm not far into the game so this is currently more a first impression than anything. I will update this when I am finished playing the game.[/b]

I've only played about 45 minutes of this but so far, it's great at teaching. It's best to have a notepad/paper and a pen handy to write things down, the game will actually tell you to go do that if you don't have one there already. The game takes things slow and encourages good ways of putthing things into memory. It starts off simple, teaching you the vowels with their pronounciation, equivalent characters in English and character in Hiragana for each one. It lets you learn things and provides options to repeat stuff so you don't have to worry about missing things and if you note things down as it tells you to, you'll start to pick them up fairly quick.

I like how it teaches you how to read, speak and write Hiragana instead of just focusing on just one of those as a lot of other things seem to try and do. It also helps that it acknowledges learning another language is daunting and difficult so I feel I can trust in it more. It defintely helps with holding my attention.

Another thing I'm loving so far is that it's doing all of this within a traditional turn based RPG. So far it's fairly simple stuff for those elements but where it really stands out is that the enemies are Hiragana characters (potentially words and other stuff later on, I'm not far in) so that in addition to attacking, defending, support and item use, you have to actually understand the enemy in a very literal sense to damage them.

That really helps with learning as it gives you just enough pressure to keep your brain working and the things you're learning will start to fit into place as a side effect of playing. Instead of learning a bunch of stats and different elements or whatever enemies are weaker too, it's another language. The game is also just fun so far and both the characters and the story are quite charming. This isn't a game that's concent with boring the player.

It's not perfect as the dialogue text characters, the on screen characters and the how to draw/write animations for characters are all a little different to each other so it can get a little confusing when learning the correct way to write stuff but I guess that gets you used to different writing styles and it didn't get in the way much, I just wanted to make sure I was writing things down perfectly. That aside, I'm pleased with it so far and I would recommend looking into this if you are interested in learning Japanese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202780104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1471227123}

review: I'm only on sa se su so shi (not in order) so i'm not far but thus far its really solid. this doesn't just need DLC for Kanji you guys should make games like this for any language. i'll be first in line for that. if i did have to gripe about something i'd say, i'd prefer if the fights incorperated older material slightly more often. i found myself going back to the first area just to brush up on the first symbols. i do feel like i'm starting to get it tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016801878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1467754308}
review:
Bought it on sale and it's worth every single penny.

Altough you don't learn much vocabulary through the game, it still teaches you the basics to start learning japanese. 
This is how you should teach people languages that use a different writing system than our standard one. I would love to see the katakana sequel and maybe another intermediate version that focuses a little bit more on vocabulary. It would also be great to see an arabic version, since you can apply the same tutoring system that is used in this game.

For everyone who ever wanted to start learning Japanese, there is probably no better software, book or game out there.

Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005278820', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1457531307}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198052613004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1467705518}
review:
As a fan of retro turn-based-RPGs and of the japanese language I can really recommend this game. It is fun to play and you have the educational factor in there, which makes this game very compelling. I do believe that people find it cumbersome to remember all kana and especially the stroke order, but this game teaches you how to do it: left to right, top to bottom, just like the japanese kids learn it in elementary school. Hiragana are the first type of characters the japanese children learn, and you basically approach the language as they do.
If you ever plan to visit Japan, as I have done it multiple times in my life, this game at least gives you some basic vocabulary. You might not be getting that far with it, but this game is pretty much evoking curiosity in people, which is a splendid effect, as they might be getting more interested in japanese language and have a decent knowledge of Hiragana once they finish this game (I believe, I am not through it yet, but if the game keeps the lessons up in this manner, this will for sure be the case).
I bought this game during the steam sale, but (given that I pretty much like both characteristic features of the game) I would also have bought it at full price.

I wish there was an equivalent game for Katakana and Kanji, I would absolutely buy them within the fraction of a second.

Judging from the perspective that this is more or less an "educational" game, I would say I haven't seen a better one in a while.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091698910', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1467659991}
review: I like the concept. Settings are really pretty minimal. I actually memorized the first 15 characters but after that, I needed some time off. My only suggestion for improvement is...can they include pictures of handwritten texts? like for example a student taking down notes or something along those lines? so that we can have a comparison with our own writings :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198138439974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1469128026}
review: As an everyday american otaku, this game is good. it shows that not all rpg maker games are bad and it teaches you something while still being fun. I already knew all the hiragana so at times for me it was a little slow, but for a person who is new to japanese this would be a great way to learn. and while the story is a little shallow and cheesy at times, that's not the main purpose of the game anyways. 8/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110398436', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1467542842}
review: 没仔细玩，但是还是申请退款了。买之前没仔细看，这个游戏应该是只有五十音图的教程，而且还是英文界面。有一定日文基础的话完全没必要用这个游戏来学日语了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198145031146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1594752385}
review:
If you want to learn the basics of Japanese, it is a very interesting game.

I was a bit unconfident about being able to remember the Hiragana symbols, but the game is cleverly designed and allows learning through repetition thanks to battles. If you don't know the enemy, you can't hit them.

I should also mention I am playing the game the hard way without taking notes (to see how well it's possible to do just by memorizing as much as possible), and I'm pleased to notice that remembering Hiragana is actually a pretty smooth process despite their complexity. Within about 1.5 hour, I became familiar with about 15 symbols.

Clearly a game to try if you're interested in Japanese, or if you also just want to have fun with an original turn-based RPG :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986221024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1467543559}
review:
Als jemand der bereits einige Wörter aus dem Japanischen kennt, sich jedoch niemals dazu durchringen konnte die Japanischen schriftzeichen zu lernen, finde ich diese Spiel einen großartigen Einfall.

Man lernt zunächst einmal alle 71! Hiragana zeichen, keine sorge einige von denen sind vergleichbar mit unserem ö, ä und ü (soll heissen das sie minimal veränderte varianten andere Schriftzeichen sind). Dazu kommen einige Wörter und Sätze aber das wichtigste ist und bleibt das man endlich eine gewisse Motivation hat sich durch diese ganzen Zeichen durchzukämpfen, im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes.

Man sollte natürlich eine gewisse Motivation für die Japanische Sprache haben aber dieses Spiel hilft einem ungemein sich einmal richtig einzuarbeiten. Es legt sozusagen die grundlage für ein Richtiges lernen der Sprache.

Als kleine Warnung : zum schluss werden auch ganze wörter abgefragt, also die am besten auch notieren

author: {'steamid': '76561198012382617', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1493343732}
review:
I bought this game just for the sake of doing so, as I've never really been interested in learning Japanese, but thought this was an interesting concept. Honestly, this "game" has impressed me greatly, and I'm actually enjoying learning a language I've had no previous interest in. If someone would take the time to produce other "games" that present learning material in a similar style, I have no doubt that every gamer around could beat out most college professors in terms of intellect. I mean, I've never even been remotely interested in Japanese, and now I think I'll want to continue learning even after I beat the game. This "game" is addictive, and presents content in a way that is sure to 'lock it away' in your memory, and keep you in a fun way of thinking as opposed to a learning mindset, so that you learn something without feeling bogged down.

TLDR: This is a great game, and has caused a desire to learn for someone who had none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072857161', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1486649780}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038783761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1467265144}
review:
This game prepares you to dip your foot in the water of learning japanese. Most things can be spelled with Hiragana, however Katakana and Kanji are used in a lot of spellings. If you play this game it will help you with learning japanese because you know how to sound things out and write them in Hiragana. Most things are spelled by how they sound. 
Side quests show you new words, and also teach you about japan.
Also the game is pretty fun without the learning aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030856663', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1468104218}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078381723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1467548010}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016292979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1544611334}
review:
This game is awesome because it delivers on it's promise. Don't expect awesome gameplay or fluent japanese. Both gameplay and the lessons are basic. The fact that the game does both really solidly makes me recommend this game.
It's well-made, it's entertaining, it's educational. It's mediocere as far as games go, but it's really good as far as educational games go.
Check it out, especially on sale!
"Why are you laughing? Did you learn something?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198182235373', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1657186032}
review:
Japoncanın bu kadar kolay olduğunu bilmiyordum. Japoncayı büyük ölçüde öğrendim. Verceğiniz paraya da fazlasıyla değer.
Eğer Japonca öğrenmeyi gerçekten istiyorsanız bu oyunu alın derim.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
I didn't know that Japanese was this easy to learn. I learned a big part of Japanese. It's worth to the money you're paying.
If you really want to learn Japanese, I say buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172640690', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1486879607}
review: 十分好玩的一款游戏，强制记住各种平假名。但缺点也很明显，就是每次平假名出现的组合都是固定的，如果变成随机的话更有利于记忆。可能因为成本问题，如果平假名读音选对的话，希望能加上语音，会让人记忆更深刻。

author: {'steamid': '76561198079369466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1555258417}

It's engaging with wonderful music and I lost several hours on my first time playing it. Totally worth it. Please do one for Katakana and Kanji.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970486658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1471503544}
review: This game is great for practicing hirgana by reinforcement.  Given the fact that I only remembered a few characters, the lessons helped me learn and improve my skills and understanding of what each character is.  I recommend this if you only have a little exposure or you are just starting out.  Having a game wrapped around the lessons make this way more interesting than the old green book!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039920670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1467389042}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162423893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1669586754}
review:
Excellent game, great design and it really made me learn Hiragana!
I only spent 8 hours on the game and now I know all Hiragana, plus some useful Japanese vocabs.
I would recommend this to anybody who wants to learn Hiragana, the fun way.

There are 2 things that I can think of to improve the game

1. Change up the words during battle more, or actually randomize it.
2. Remove the flash when battle starts, it hurts my eyes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146135233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1468629781}

Make sure you have a notebook standing by when you play this game! practicing writing the characters helps you truly learn the beginnings of this language and remeber them even when you're not playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044416975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1469412998}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079353605', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1470677404}
review:
If you like RPG maker type game and want to learn japaneese, i would say..... why noooot ! :o :3 

Learn Hiragana or they're going to destroy the world. It's chaos. No time to waste ! 

I started to learn japaneese few weeks ago. After not practicing my hiragana for a week or so, i had a small blank and i decided to buy this game. Just to refresh my memory and to practice. I think it's pretty complete. They put vocabulary too, some 'particules' of pronunciation... For my part, i think they try to make this game casual and funny. I think it worked out pretty well. You may still need a little bit of practice on your own tho, like writing down the hiragana often, read them out loud, etc. But this game makes hiragana learning more fun. 

If they're doing a katakana version or kanji, i'll definitely go for it !

author: {'steamid': '76561198103487022', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1467393309}
review: This game taught me amazing new Japanese words, such as "sushi," "sensei," and "ohayou gozaimasu." It's not the best, but it's a good place to start, I think. I don't really learn other languages easily. Maybe I should stop typing now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050915555', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1558753745}
review:
One could expect a lame game with educational purposes, akin to those musics your teachers invent to help you memorize the subject. But even as a game, it is fairly good. It teachs japanese really easily and the combat is well balanced.
The only two drawbacks, that in no way should make you give up on buying this game, are the lame dialogs (the guys are not from CD Project, cut them some slack) and the "answers" menu that gets progressively bigger as you progress through the game.
bonus points for the bonus point mechanic that let's you buy levels with points you get from side quests, and for the talking dog.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007469949', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1467235665}
review:
This 2D novel-rpg about hiragana will kick your ass until you get learnt the whole hiragana :D

P.S. It's a lovely game with some quite nice mechanics like showing the correct pronunciation and spelling, also it has a pretty funny plot and you're gonna repeat a lot to learn hiragana

Однако после непольшой порции сюжетного юмора нужна передышка. Играть в неё стоит по настроению, иначе ни пользы, ни фана не будет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057022343', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1467195377}
review: Haven't played much of it, but holy shit is it effective. I've played less than 30 minutes and I've already basically learned 50 times more than I ever knew of Japanese. Tip, get a notebook and do every little thing the game says and you'll know basic Japanese in less than 3 days that's how effective this game is at teaching you the characters. If you're an anime fan and wanna learn japanese get this, it's probably the single most effective japanese teaching ideas out there. Schools should use stuff like this instead of boring bookwork to teach. it is so much fun and engaging. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082965729', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1467235674}
review: Please make more games like this one. I would learn the basics of each language if it was this fun and engaging. It is just 2£ and it makes up for a 200£ course or something. I am not even particularly interested in manga or anime or any of the culture and I still am enjoying the hell out of this game. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025172233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1498156340}
review:
7.8/10 "It's okay" -Not enough Nihongo

7 hours in and I'm able to comprehend Japanese product labels.  I'm beginning to wrap my head around some untranslated (if basic) manga.  Need to level up your weeb this year?  Well... there might be more effective ways to learn Hiragana out there, for less of your money and time.  But if you're like me and too lazy to learn anything without there being at least a backdrop of entertainment, this will trick you into doing something productive.  Maybe it's something you never knew you wanted to do!  So grab a notebook and some pencils, because it's time to start drawin' some moonrunes.

This game takes the tedium and grind of SNES-era JRPGs and repurposes them into an effective means for hard memorization.  Sure, it has juvenile contrivances to keep you fighting and the dungeons are arbitrarily long, but it's all part of the plan.  You might have had to walk the length of that cabin six times to find a key, but you won't forget the difference between さ and ち again, now will you?  The occasional sweet loot or strategic consideration is just immersive enough to make you think you're playing a game.  This will keep you learning.

Recommended because you will actually learn stuff.  Best $3 on Steam I ever spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118943466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1696222048}

I have enjoyed this game so much i don't care if you want to learn japanese or not this is a fun game! i am also really learning a lot and it's kinda freaking me out how much better i am learning this stuff then practicing on my own 10/10
i will buy katana war and what ever kanji game they make!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071451959', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1467170708}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015598897', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1467164011}
review: I used Dr. Moku (online site) to learn Hiragana, but from the amount I played of this it seems like a solid way to learn. It would have been a lot better if it had Katakana, and if it had Kanij it would have been perfect. If this ever gets Kanji DLC I would happy throw $40 at this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014749813', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1467160566}
review:
If your want to learn Hiragana, rather download any app for your smartphone. Search for one with user tips. Those are far better than the "tips" given in the game which basically just tell you the number of strokes to write the character with and to watch out for the placement.
The apps will also include more than just Hiragana.
The game itself is very clunky with its controls and rather dull to play.
As a free hobby game i wouldn't mind, but it's not worth it even with the summer sale discount given the free alternatives at hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170091433', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1467099359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093574369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1467150317}
review:
[b]tl;dr[/b] 

hmmm... ¿sabes ingles? ¿y quieres aprender japones y no tienes ni idea? coño, compralo, es genial!

--------------------

Lo he encontrado de casualidad por 2,79 de rebajas de steam, se (sabia) literalmente 0 de japones. lo tipico de ver anime, kawaii, tadaima, itadakimasu...

Llevo 4 horas jugadas, y he aprendido ya 35 caracteres de los 46 que tiene el hiragana... y me esta pareciendo hasta FACIL!
La idea de la repeticion y el grindeo de los juegos de estrategia por turnos es genial para aprender :D


Por no hablar del PLOT! que historia! 

jaja no es coña, la historia es una escusa barata, pero ¿que mas da? ademas, a mi me hizo gracia, llega un mago y en vez de lanzar hechizos en elfico o asi... habla japones y por eso tienes que aprender... jajaja


Pues eso, que lo explican todo muy bien, y te van pronunciando las cosas (que se parece mucho al español, la verdad) 

[b]Siempre y cuando sepas ingles, eso si...[/b]

10/10 RECOMENDADISIMO!

review: One of the best educational games i have ever played. I went into this knowing a little bit of japanese but virtually no knowledge of Hiragana (The base written language of japanese). If you want to have fun while learning japanese i strongly reccomend picking up this game. Definitely looking forward to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028463816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1467105693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198193116154', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1467076165}
review:
Japanese to Survive delivers an exceptional introduction to those learning the language for the first time. The game provides a overview of Hiragana syllables, the fundamental writing system of Japanese grammar, with a number of vocabulary terms. Intermediate learners can brush up on old lessons while wishfully hoping on Katakana and Kanji DLC inclusions.

In the story, you play as a group of teenagers battling to retake their village from omnious "Hiragana warriors." The premise of a village being overthrown by Japanese syllables graciously teeters the line between cheesy educational writing and the script to a B+ anime. Writing aside, Japanese to Survive pairs its lessons with turn-based RPG battle sequences that ensure you are always reviewing material.

Overall, I highly suggest Japanese to Survive to any first-timers or anyone initially intimidated by a highly symbolic, Asian language. Each lesson is succinct in educating the player about the pronunciations, translations and writing strokes of each Hiragana character. The battles are a rewarding experience, knowing that you are applying the knowledge you just learned. I recommend having a pen and notebook ready alongside each playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960554274', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1466923690}
review:
So far, in around 40 minutes or so I managed to learn 15 hiragana.  I would say that 100% more japanese than I knew prior to buying this game.  The presentation is well done, and you feel like you accomplished something when you can recognize letters without looking back at your notes. 

I think this will be very fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198056661728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1467072794}
review: I only have 4 hours down and I'm learning tons (whilst enjoying the music, artwork and gameplay incredibly)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041995956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1466990656}
review:
I studied Japanese for 2 years in school and 4 years on my own, so I feel this game is a bit below my level, but I wanted a way to refresh on the basics and this game is okay, but also a bit flawed.

There is a lot of grinding in the game, it feels very RPG maker generic in terms of story and graphics, and the game tended to crash on me every hour or so, requiring constant saving or lost effort.

The battle mechanics are okay and help you memorize Japanese characters through rote practice in the RPG battle system, however it's noticably clunky, such as when you try to go down to get back tot he top of your menu, it is disabled and if you overattack an enemy, your next attacker will miss if he still attacked the same target.  Old school stuff that's frustrating.  Still, for an entry level Japanese game it gives you the entire alphabet, plenty of room to practice, and a few phrases and words to go with it.  The best part of the game is easily the last run, where you start using phrases instead of simple sounds to fight enemies.

I would recommend this game to fans of RPGs looking for entry level Japanese knowledge.  Could also be a good gateway for kids.  However, it is noticably clunky and crash prone.  Still, they advertised a sequel and I'd buy it, if only for the practice.  Give it a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166066690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1469289641}
review:
Great Game
If you want to learn Hiragana then you should buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025630961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1467600695}
review:
As someone who learned a bit of conversational japanese, but no hiragana, I think this is a great way to approach the language from a different direction.  A brand new student of the language would probably want to start with a conversational approach, and use this game to supplement.  But that's only to maintain interest.  There's technically no reason a person couldn't start with this game.  

The game is repetitive and grows in complexity pretty quickly.  It's not something you'll want to play for hours on end, but it's not intended for that either.  It's better as a quick daily event over a long period of time.  Really enjoying it so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030846606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1467069218}
review: Definitely a new take on learning Japanese that kept me engaged and wanting more. They dialogue might be a bit cheesey for some people but it doesnt detract from the fantastic game here and its ability to teach you basic Japanese. Highly recommend to anyone interested in learning the language or even if you are like me and just want a fun way to brush up and reinforce the basics!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141281551', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1467056178}
review:
I never thought I'd learn this much through playing a game!
Sometimes it gets a little grindy (you have to kill the same characters over and over) but that helps memorizing those characters (so 'yay' i guess...). 
Only thing I'd point out is that the characters you learn at the begining stop appearing throghout the game, so by the end I didn't remember some of them.
No achievements :(, but if you finish all side quests you get a bonus :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084390721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1467579257}
review:
This is sincerely a brilliant way to teach a language! The story is fun and engaging but doesn't take itself too seriously, the lessons are concise and easy to follow and there's a nice connection, as a player, to your team because you're learning along with them. 

I also love how, as you learn new hiragana, you can go back and review earlier lessons, especially the vocabulary lessons, and rewrite the words using more hiragana each time. I truly and sincerely hope the creators of this game create a follow-up for more advanced learners for the kanji and katakana. 

Would I recommend this game to people wanting to learn Japanese from the very basics? I already have several times and I'm only just barely scratching the surface myself!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076323403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1467002031}
review:
I played this game for a little while so here are my thoughts:

It's interesting in how the story set up to require the characters to learn Japanese. It's cute and defiently something I think would be a good learning aid. Would love to see more games like this out there! 

I would reccomend this game to beginners. People who don't know their hiragana or struggle with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168250502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1466902234}
review: I bought this game because I'm japanese and I know the amount of japanese that a baby knows. I got this game and it was easy to begin with at the start. The controls are simple, the gameplay is interactive, and the teaching is unique and helpful. I've learned more japanese in this game in an hour than I have living my 15 years of life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220156817', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1467041761}
review:
I'm sorry,but i think it is not a good idea to learn Japanese just by this.

Yes, it does provide some necessary things to learn Hiragana, such as how to write, how to read etc.But I think its way to review or remember, is a bit stupid, and quite slow. Killing monsters to make a choice seems interesting, but in fact it can only help you with "recognition", yet you won't learn further usage or practice its pronunciation. Not to mention the less of Katakana -- same or even more common, and should be learned together with Hiragana.I also believe that in this way the learners may not form constant memories and can forget it easily.

Frankly speaking, I felt really excited when I saw this during the period of learning Japanese as a very beginner, and using RPG Maker to make a learning "game" is quite creative.However,compared with my free online video lessons from Netease in China, this is not so cool as I expected.

----------------------------------
实话说,真想学日语的还是别买这个了,网易云课堂有沪江网校的免费课程,比这个要好得多.
打怪记假名真的不是一个好方法, 虽然用RPG游戏大师制作学习软件也算是一种非常革命性的尝试.
太慢了,而且绝对容易忘的.
另外你真的不需要一起记片假名吗?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000545500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1467117625}
review:
I've just completed a beginner course in Japanese so I know hiragana and katakana, but there are just some that you don't see as often so they're easier to forget. Playing this game is really good for that, but it also teaches you words, greetings, etc. I haven't played this game for too long, but I'd like to suggest that the menu should be made easier to navigate (double clicking in some places, single clicking in other places, lots of clicking) - that the option of typing the hiragana instead of scrolling through a long list to be added and it'd be cool if you could customise the main character. I'd love to see a little me sprite going through on an adventure. Plus kanji edition.
Great game, highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000549152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1558798889}
review:
Classic turn based RPG style.
You don't have to worry about any other abilities apart from answering the hiragana characters properly and healing.
I don't think I've ever taken notes before in a video game.
Sank about 6 hours into it on the first day.
I look forward to the next installment on Katakana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123613292', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1467022731}
review: 一个不错的平假名教程，虽然打完了之后感觉顺手就要忘光了……

author: {'steamid': '76561198049473969', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1629264676}
review:
Mas entretenido de lo que pense en un primer momento :)
Aunque en ingles, es bastante facil de llevar... y habra que entrenar, eso si... pero siempre como un RPG :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198176559634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1467975920}
review: 這個游戲還是相當有趣的，用正確的發音才能幹掉敵人，很適合進行日文和中文這種象形文字的學習，如果長時間看日本動畫而有了一定基礎的話，學習起來效率更高，希望制作組能做出更好的學習型游戲

author: {'steamid': '76561198051496037', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1467168054}

author: {'steamid': '76561198154396341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1467004008}
review: Works great for a teaching tool, helped me get a structure to learn hiragana and quickly learn it. Dialouge needs some work and I know it's so i get more practice but going back and forth between randomly spawning enemies for some plot reason is the worst. Pretty good other than that and it's dirt cheap, worth the price

author: {'steamid': '76561197972631265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1466984710}
review:
This game is actually useful, very useful. So useful that I have to write a review to testify for it.

I play 1 level a day, 3 days in i've already learned 25 hiragana letters and some vocabs/short phrases.
This is the least boring way i think, and somewhat fun, for people to learn Japanese.

Keep in mind this is more of an educational piece of work than an actual game :0) Or, the only game in this era that can be justified with repetitive grinding, excessive backtracking and overly simplistic dungeon design.

Don't try to punch through it, that's not the point of playing this 'game'. Part of the reasons why I play only 1 level per day is to keep myself interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046523811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1466973335}
review: While the story and gameplay is nothing revolutionary, this is a welcome change from sitting in a room with flashcards for hours at a tme. The entire campaign took me about 12 hours to complete (the rest of that time is from accidentally leaving the game open overnight), and it is spaced out enough to play the game full through if you'd prefer. I look forawrd to the Katakana sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093934489', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1640278803}
review: Dette er en morsom måte å lære å lese Japansk, men jeg merker at jeg likevel må skrive ned bokstavene og titte litt når jeg ikke klarer å huske dem. Et fint spill for dem som liker å lære nye ting, men har ikke spilt nok enda for å vite om dette faktisk kommer veldig bra med om du reiser til Japan for å bruke noe av det. Spiller jeg mer og reiser til Japan, så gir jeg dere beskjedXD

author: {'steamid': '76561198112773614', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1479061070}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138720239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1466966836}
review:
It's fun learning Hiragana with this classic little RPG. Grab a pen and paper to make notes as you battle your way to Hiragana literacy. 

PROS:
- Helpful when traditional learning methods aren't your thing
- Teaches words and phrases to support reading words in Hiragana
- Audio pronunciation helps tune your ears and your tongue
- Comments on some common font differences in appearance

CONS:
- Sans serif font on lessons would be appreciated
- Attack menu is rather long. Submenu by consonant/vowel would reduce scrolling.

SCORE: 4/5
Solid little game, DLC for Katakana and/or Kanji would be awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059491817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1468850567}
review:
Un excellent jeu pour connaitre et introduire la langue japonaise, sa culture, ses usages et son vocabulaire pour ceux qui veulent l'apprendre. Mais encore, pour ceux également qui en connaissent les rudiments/bases mais que les années passant ont émoussé les connaissances en hiragana.
Le faire de manière simple et ludique, en connaissant non seulement la prononciation, mais aussi la manière d'écrire. Un petit test avant d'entrer en jeu pour péréniser ses connaissances et sa mémoire (et occire) des hiraganas est un coup de maitre.

Un jeu parfait pour accompagner ceux qui veulent apprendre le japonais en autodidacte. N'oubliez pas de prendre un carnet pour tout noter et pratiquez (jouez) régulièrement. N'hésitez pas à faire les quêtes secondaires pour en apprendre davantage en matière de vocabulaire et de culture.

A quand le Katakana Battle ou le Kanji Battle ? 
A quand un nouveau jeu pour apprendre une autre langue ? 

L'initiative et l'idée du jeu est excellente et je le recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253401911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1468607709}

lazy to recite the Hiragana from the book,play this game instead .100%help in beginer learning japanese .

author: {'steamid': '76561198207146213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1467267555}
review: Absolutely useful for learning Japanese! You can easily get those hiragana characters memorized by fighting against the warriors. The only problem is, it cannot be saved on the steam cloud, I have two computers, and they couldn't share the progress. After all, if you had no idea with Japanese, you can't miss it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106165289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1603972205}

author: {'steamid': '76561198109671117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1515100253}
review:
This is the perfect way for someone like me to stay focused and study. I didn't want to stop at all! Can't wait for Katakana Battle to come out, since that's my weakness.  Also hoping for a Kanji version, although it wasn't mentioned in the game. 
Anyway, it's perfect for beginners/intermediates to learn/refresh their memory in Japanese and get some easy vocab in, it just tricks you into keeping it up by mixing in some RPG fun and distracting you by thinking about gearing up/levelling. There's also a few quests, wouldn't mind to see more of those! Definitely worth the money and my time. Keep it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165663672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1482331392}
review:
学了两年日语的渣渣偶然看到这个游戏就买了=。=里面的内容虽然都是基础不能再基础的东西，现在反过来却觉得意外有意思。对于英语可以（像我一样托福79就能看懂啦），想学日语的同学们而言，是一个不错的游戏。寓教于乐，十分素质教育（不是）。
回想起刚刚开始学习日语的时候，不要说写假名，想要记住假名怎么读都是个问题。我当时是个问题学生，上课玩手机不听课，虽然想着去日本留学，但是学日语怎么也努力不起来。当时补课班老师一周一下子给我留20个假名（其实不难），我就是背不下来。后来老师说，不行，你这样下去学不了，我就有点害怕了，才开始努力学日语。一周20个假名，加上前一周留下的一共40个，我决定我拼了命也要背下来。手机一收，上语文课开始背假名。上课咱溜号可以，但是总也不能影响别人吧，所以我只能记住罗马音+假名，但是一听读音就反应不过来了。总之也是经历了很多吧，到现在也算是基本成型了，和外教老师直接用日语交流也都没障碍了。一共用了整两年。
一下子想起很多有点语无伦次……近年学日语的不知道为啥貌似是在增加，也许是ACG的缘故吧。我看过同补课班一个同学，纯粹是为了ACG一点爱好学日语，初级书才学9课就已经不行了，上课总是哭。老师开导也不好使。现在时常想起来，感觉分外心痛。学语言绝对不是简单的事情，学一门语言之前不能凭着一腔热血就冲上去，要好好想想，自己究竟为什么学这门语言。游戏里这些人是为了打倒邪恶势力（可以，这很ACG）学，现实中很多人是为了留学/当翻译去学，或者说是为了ACG。什么理由都可以，但是一定要有一个理由去学日语，不然，最好还是不要学，就像我学了两年半法语现在半句法语都吐不出来（破学校英语特长班教法语，不是很懂）。
希望能给大家一点帮助。打折11元的确是很便宜的游戏，两顿饭的事。

author: {'steamid': '76561198138660340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1474450564}
review: 无论是手机还是电脑上，我试过了很多日语学习软件，但没有一个能让我坚持到学完五十音的，只有这个游戏让我坚持了下来，强烈推荐

author: {'steamid': '76561197973554575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1634846572}
review: Very easy to get into, and very basic.  This will teach you the Hiragana alphabet and some very, very basic Japanese quite quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057185058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1466848069}
review: This is an extremely addicting educational game. I've tried self teaching learning Japanese using a few books, but that was nearly impossible. This game makes learning a new language somewhat easy and very fun. The combat reinforces the lessons to help you remember the characters. You'll need a notebook and something to write with since you're learning a new language (obviously). So far I've only gotten a bit over 2 hours in the game and I've learned a decent amount about Hiragana. This game looked promising when I purchased it, and it lived up to my expectations. I thought the combat and RPG mechanics would be terrible since it's an educational game; but the game is very solid. The lessons are at a reasonable size so you aren't overwhelmed and it gives you a few hints about the specific character you're learning. Don't forget to take as many notes as possible, it really helps. So far this game has been worth the purchase, a lot of love and work went into this game. If you're looking to learn Japanese you'll want to start with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026359247', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1466883796}
review:
While I haven't played much quite yet, I must say its a really great "game" for introduction to Japanese. 
I've been putting off learning Japanese for far too long and this is just the sort of thing I need to give me the proper steps to learning. 
With it currently being on sale for less than 3 dollars, I'd say thats well worth the price! 
Saves me from trying to teach myself and finding the study materials or paying for a class that would be far more expensive and less fun. 

Will update once I've played more but so far I have no complaints. 
Progress (1 Hour and I know 15 Characters of Hiragana)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080124784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1466833005}

author: {'steamid': '76561198097592586', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1467258978}
review:
作为一个英语GG开始自学日语的中国人，这款游戏非常好，我喜欢，除了英语看不懂。
I NEED CHINESE TO LEARN JAPANESE！！！！！
好吧，这和游戏无关，如果想学日语可以来买买，但我这个英语渣是看不懂游戏的剧情的。。。。。。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198108030754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1528597726}
review:
Very neat! I studied Japanese in college and the writing of the characters is very accurate! :) I hope that a katakana and kanji version of this game comes out! It is totally fun and educational.  If you would like to learn the basics of hiragana, I recommend this game! ^.^

Edit: The only character that I have seen which is not accurate is "ri り". They use one stroke writting it in the game, but the written form isn't connected and is done in 2 strokes.  The game does however show the correct form of "ri り" when battling the hiragana warriors.  It is ok for it to be connected on a typed font, but not when hand writting it.  Other than that, kudos for making a game that teaches writting Japanese! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198035319122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1466817059}
review: Needs DLC for other kanji and katakana. Sequel for words and such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027915716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1467452302}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel durchgespielt und kann sagen , dass es es sich lohnt um japanisch zu lernen. Allerdings muss man am ball bleiben und nicht zu lange pause machen.

Das Spiel ansich macht viel Spaß, wenn man bedenkt das ein Bösewicht die Welt mit japanischen Schriftzeichen zerstören will, weglest.
Zum ende des Spiels wird es schwiriger, ich musste selbstnotizen machen und gelegentlich während des Spielens auf mein notizblock nachschauen, obwohl es nicht vorgesehen ist zu schummeln. (Wie in der Schule bei einen Test :)) Empfehle daher auswendig lernen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065272179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1466854447}
review: It's on Steam Sale for a couple bucks, and you should totally pick it up if you have any interest in learning Japanese. The more you farm the more you study. If I could learn more languages in game form, I'd be omnilingual. As expected, the RPG element is a little slower than your average, but it also has to teach you stuff the same time, so give it a sec. It is an awesome experience so far guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053904359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1636647441}
